commits.subject: feat: enhance comparison view with summary and winner indicators
commits.body:
Add "Quick Summary" section at top of comparison view:
- Shows best-for insights per option (e.g., "Best for net profit and lower TP risk")
- Grid layout adapts to number of options being compared
- Only displays when there are clear winners to report

Add winner indicators in comparison table:
- ★ star icon marks best value for each metric
- Green text and background highlighting for winning values
- Smart detection avoids marking ties as winners

Completes Priority 3 of Negotiation Mode implementation:
- Summary row in comparison view
- Winner indicators per metric
commits.title: enhance comparison view with summary and winner indicators

commits.subject: feat: implement Negotiation Mode UI changes
commits.body:
Based on Discovery Framework findings, implement "Simplified by Default" approach
for client-facing negotiation sessions.

Input Field Enhancements:
- Add benchmark property for industry standard badges (e.g., "Industry: 5-15%")
- Add essential property to control field grouping
- InputField displays benchmark badges next to labels

Calculator Page Refactor:
- Progressive disclosure: Essential inputs visible, Advanced collapsed
- Sensitivity/Projections moved to collapsible "Advanced Analysis" section
- Transfer Pricing collapsed by default (shows risk badge)
- One-click save with auto-generated names
- Saved options count shown in action bar

This aligns with the 5 design principles from discovery:
1. Client in the room - cleaner, less overwhelming UI
2. Neutral ground first - industry benchmarks prominently displayed
3. Show both sides - Developer/Buyer results always visible
4. Progressive complexity - advanced features tucked away
5. Compare to decide - prominent save, easy comparison flow
commits.title: implement Negotiation Mode UI changes

commits.subject: docs: add Negotiation Mode design and UI audit
commits.body:
Created NEGOTIATION_MODE.md with:
- 5-minute client walkthrough script
- Screen-by-screen requirements for negotiation use case
- Feature visibility matrix (show/hide by mode)
- Implementation recommendation: "Simplified by Default"

Completed UI audit against 5 design principles:
- Client in the room: Partial - tabs may confuse
- Neutral ground first: Fix needed - no benchmark badges
- Show both sides: Good - Developer/Buyer panels work
- Progressive complexity: Fix needed - all inputs visible
- Compare to decide: Partial - save requires modal

Created prioritised fix list:
- Priority 1: Industry badges, collapse advanced features, one-click save
- Priority 2: Group inputs into Essential/Advanced
- Priority 3: Comparison view enhancements
commits.title: add Negotiation Mode design and UI audit

commits.subject: docs: complete discovery session and document findings
commits.body:
Applied Discovery Framework to understand actual tool usage:
- Key finding: tool used WITH clients in live negotiations, not as back-office calculator
- Actual users: tech-sales + non-technical exec + finance exec
- Tool enters after discovery, during "let's structure this together"

Created DISCOVERY_FINDINGS.md with:
- Full session documentation (People, Flow, Data, Why Now)
- Gap analysis comparing findings vs current solution
- 5 design principles derived from discovery
- Plan: define negotiation mode → audit UI → create fix list

Updated TODO.md with high-priority alignment tasks
Updated SESSION_NOTES.md with current state and next steps
commits.title: complete discovery session and document findings

commits.subject: docs: add Discovery Framework methodology guide
commits.body:
Add comprehensive guide for conducting user discovery sessions covering:
- Core principle of user flows as the spine
- Session 1 structure (People, Flow, Data, Contacts, Why Now)
- Post-session analysis checklist
- Follow-up session templates by stakeholder type
- Language guide for non-technical audiences
- Data complexity signals reference
commits.title: add Discovery Framework methodology guide

commits.subject: docs: clean up stale documentation and update for new architecture
commits.body:
Deleted (10 files):

- README.md - updated for TypeScript/SvelteKit architecture

commits.subject: docs: enhance CALCULATIONS.md with formula clarifications and missing elements
commits.body:
- Clarify payback period formula context (recurring vs one-time models)
- Reconcile Model 4 variant numbering with use case documentation
- Add buy-in/buy-out/balancing payment calculations for CCA (Model 3)
- Define margin compliance ranges in TP risk section with indicative table
- Fix BOT TP assessment language (remove incorrect "not applicable")
- Add Section 11(e) verification note referencing SARS IN 47
- Add IFRS 15 variable consideration constraint for earnouts
- Clarify One-Time model buyer cost methodology
- Add Mode 1/Mode 2 calculator model mapping table
- Acknowledge economies of scale limitation in assumptions
commits.title: enhance CALCULATIONS.md with formula clarifications and missing elements

commits.subject: docs: enhance Model 6 SaaS use cases with missing elements
commits.body:
Technical corrections:
- Add jurisdictional characterisation caveat (services vs royalties)
- Note implementation cost capitalisation exception to OPEX claim
- Correct 6G regulatory reference (SARB → POPIA/sector regulations)
- Add PE implications note to 6G data residency

New content:
- Add IP ownership guidance section for 6E customisations
- Cross-reference 6I with Model 2F (white-label comparison)
- Add "Standard SaaS Contract Elements" section covering:
  - Service credits and downtime economics
  - Data portability and exit rights
  - Auto-renewal and termination mechanics
  - Data ownership and usage rights

Selection guide restructured:
- Group into pricing variants (6A-6D) and combinable options
- Show example enterprise combination (6B + 6F + 6G + 6H)
- Add common mistakes for data portability, IP ownership, characterisation
commits.title: enhance Model 6 SaaS use cases with missing elements

commits.subject: docs: fix arithmetic and enhance Model 5 use cases
commits.body:
Technical corrections:
- Fix 5B arithmetic: R1.75M annual payments at 8% (was R1.5M with incorrect total)
- Add 5B note on separating interest from principal for TP/withholding
- Add 5C note on supportable discount rate (Buyer credit risk)
- Soften 5E source code premium claim (was "typically 20-50%")
- Add 5G earnout revenue definition guidance with specific example
- Expand 5G TP consideration re: earnout exceeding expectations

New content:
- Add "Sale Mechanics for All Variants" section covering:
  - What transfers (customers, employees, liabilities, data, infrastructure)
  - TP characterisation risk (sale vs licence recharacterisation)
  - IFRS 15 revenue recognition by variant
- Note 5F and 5H combinability with other variants
- Restructure selection guide into payment/relationship/scope categories
- Add common mistakes for transfer mechanics and characterisation risk
commits.title: fix arithmetic and enhance Model 5 use cases

commits.subject: docs: correct BOT model errors in Model 4 use cases
commits.body:
Major structural changes:
- Restructure 4G from standalone variant to Standard Provisions section
- Add operation period economics section (Build/Operate/Transfer phases)
- Add transition and knowledge transfer provisions
- Clarify 4F as staged acquisition extending traditional BOT

Technical corrections:
- Fix 4B: Replace unrealistic 5x GMV multiple with revenue-based formula
- Soften 4C "highest defensibility" to "strong defensibility" with caveats
- Rename 4D to "Cost Recovery with Gain Sharing" and clarify distinction
- Fix 4H: UK does not withhold on standard service fees
- Add 4A long-duration TP risk note
- Add valuation multiple guidance to 4B
- Update selection guide (remove 4G as variant option)
- Expand common mistakes with new entries
commits.title: correct BOT model errors in Model 4 use cases

commits.subject: docs: correct fundamental CCA errors in Model 3 use cases
commits.body:
Major structural changes:
- Rename 3A from "Proportional" to "Equal" (contradiction resolved)
- Rewrite 3C to align contributions with benefits per OECD CCA principles
- Restructure 3G from standalone variant to "Required Provisions" section
- Clarify 3D as mutual development, not a CCA

Technical corrections:
- Remove incorrect "no intercompany profit" claim
- Add buy-in, buy-out, and balancing payment mechanics to overview
- Strengthen 3A TP warning to "presumptively non-arm's length"
- Add periodic review requirement to 3C
- Add commercialisation value methodology to 3E
- Expand 3F JV licensing complexity warning
- Add Pillar Two note to 3H Irish tax rate example
- Update selection guide (remove 3G as variant option)
- Expand common mistakes with new entries
commits.title: correct fundamental CCA errors in Model 3 use cases

commits.subject: docs: correct technical inaccuracies in Model 2 use cases
commits.body:
- Add IFRS 15 caveat for 2A revenue recognition (bundled obligations)
- Soften 2F reseller margin range with industry context
- Replace 2G "typical" premium with fact-specific language
- Expand 2E TP complexity discussion with specific challenges
- Add cross-border withholding tax note to overview
- Clarify 2D vs 2C positioning for unpredictable usage
- Add common mistake about 2A perpetual with planned enhancements
- Expand 2H escrow trigger conditions
- Fix 2E attribution methodology terminology
- Add DEMPE analysis note to 2G exclusivity TP consideration
commits.title: correct technical inaccuracies in Model 2 use cases

commits.subject: docs: correct transfer pricing inaccuracies in Model 1 use cases

- Replace OECD guidelines citation with market benchmark language
- Clarify that zero-margin arrangements can attract TP scrutiny
- Distinguish accounting consolidation from tax TP obligations
- Fix margin vs markup terminology in 1D example

commits.title: correct transfer pricing inaccuracies in Model 1 use cases

commits.subject: docs: add realistic use case scenarios for all 47 variants
commits.body:
Document when each transaction model variant is the best choice:
- Model 1: Development Services (6 variants)
- Model 2: Software Licence (8 variants)
- Model 3: Joint Development (8 variants)
- Model 4: Build-Operate-Transfer (8 variants)
- Model 5: Software Sale (8 variants)
- Model 6: SaaS/Subscription (9 variants)

Each file includes real-world examples, variant selection guides,
transfer pricing considerations, and common mistakes to avoid.
commits.title: add realistic use case scenarios for all 47 variants

commits.subject: feat: complete pricing calculator with all 5 models + remove legacy code
commits.body:
Pricing Calculator (Mode 1):
- Implemented all 5 pricing models with equilibrium analysis:
  * Subscription (SaaS): Monthly recurring revenue
  * Usage-Based: Pay per unit (API calls, transactions)
  * Per-Seat: Price per user/seat
  * One-Time: Perpetual license + maintenance
  * Marketplace: Commission-based model
- Each model shows equilibrium zone (minimum to maximum viable price)
- Displays suggested price, financial metrics, and ROI for both parties
- Reactive calculations with proper input validation

Legacy Cleanup:
- Deleted entire /legacy/ folder (1.3MB vanilla JS code)
- Updated CLAUDE.md to reflect new TypeScript + SvelteKit architecture
- Removed ~50 legacy files (models, calculators, UI components)

Both modes now complete in new architecture:
- Mode 1: Pricing Calculator (5 models)
- Mode 2: Transaction Structuring (6 models, 47 variants)
commits.title: complete pricing calculator with all 5 models + remove legacy code

commits.subject: feat: implement pricing calculator with subscription model
commits.body:
- Replaced placeholder with working pricing calculator
- Added model selector (5 models: subscription, usage-based, per-seat, one-time, marketplace)
- Implemented subscription model with equilibrium analysis
- Shows minimum price (seller needs), maximum price (buyer willing to pay), and suggested price
- Displays financial metrics, seller position, and client ROI
- Real-time reactive calculations as inputs change
- Subscription model fully functional, other 4 models to be added

The calculator helps find the price range where both seller hits margin AND buyer sees ROI.
commits.title: implement pricing calculator with subscription model

commits.subject: fix: use base path for all navigation links
commits.body:
Import `base` from `$app/paths` and prefix all href attributes and
goto() calls to fix 404 errors on GitHub Pages deployment where the
app is served from /model-pear/ rather than the root.
commits.title: use base path for all navigation links

commits.subject: fix: set NODE_ENV=production in build step
commits.body:
Ensures SvelteKit uses the /model-pear base path for GitHub Pages.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.title: set NODE_ENV=production in build step

commits.subject: fix: set base path for GitHub Pages deployment
commits.body:
Assets were loading from root (/_app/) instead of /model-pear/_app/,
causing 404 errors on the deployed site.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
commits.title: set base path for GitHub Pages deployment
